featured.text: In fact, some researchers believe that the 34 of dimples from parents to children takes only one gene.
Recent studies show that humans and zebrafish have the same major organs and share 70 percent of the genes.
This can be clearly demonstrated by comparing the genes of chimpanzees and those of humans: the difference between them is just about 2 percent. .
But an actual synesthesia gene (or genes) has not been identified yet.
Moreover, 84 percent of human genes associated with disease find a counterpart in zebrafish.

other.text: If neither of the parents has dimple genes, their children will not 35 the trait.

According to the passage, which of the following is an opinion, but NOT a fact? (A) Humans and zebrafish have 70 percent of genes in common. (B) Zebrafish can quickly recover vision after damage to the retina.

definition.zh_def: 基因是遺傳物質的基本單位，負責傳遞遺傳特徵。
definition.en_def: A gene is the basic unit of heredity in a living organism, responsible for transmitting genetic traits.
definition.example: Each parent contributes genes to their child, determining various characteristics.
